# Introduction

This vignette introduces the **transcribe** package. The package provides an R interface to transcribe audio using Whisper, with optional post‚Äêprocessing via Ollama. It supports both a programmatic interface and a command-line interface (CLI).

## Installation

```{r, eval=FALSE}
# Install from GitHub (if not on CRAN yet)
# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("YourUserName/transcribe")
```

## Basic Usage

Below is a minimal example showing how to transcribe an audio file:

```{r, eval=FALSE}
# library(transcribe) # Uncomment once your package is installed
# transcript <- transcribe_audio(
#   input_path = "path/to/audio.wav",
#   language = "en",
#   whisper_model_name = "large-v3-turbo",
#   processed = TRUE,
#   ollama_model = "llama3.2"
# )
# cat(transcript)
```

## CLI Usage

The **transcribe** package also provides a command-line interface (CLI). Once installed, you can run the CLI from your terminal. For example, if you have a script set up in `inst/scripts/cli.R`, you can execute:

```bash
Rscript inst/scripts/cli.R -i "path/to/audio.wav" -l en -m large-v3-turbo -p TRUE -M llama3.2 -o "transcribe.txt"
```

This command will process the specified audio file and save the resulting transcript to `transcribe.txt`.

## Plumber Integration

You can serve a web interface via **plumber**:

```{r, eval=FALSE}
# library(plumber)
# plumber::plumb("inst/plumber/api.R")$run(port = 7608)
```

Then open your browser at [http://127.0.0.1:7608](http://127.0.0.1:7608) to access the interface.

## Conclusion

This vignette covered the basics of installing and using **transcribe** for audio transcription, including examples for both programmatic usage and command-line usage. For further details, refer to the package documentation and additional vignettes.
